column4: why does nautilus now behave like I am clicking everything with the middle mouse button and closing the parent window?
it's not as "spatial" as it used to be ;)
yea but I want the old be havior
why did they change the behavior?
cuz the guy paying for Ubuntu development likes it that way...
it is not gnomes fault this time though...
besides... just go to Applications > System Tools > File Browser and you get the old look (single window navigation..)
I already told you, this time, its Mark Shuttleworth's fault.
ie, its not changed at all in mainstream gnome...
all they did is change the gconf setting though... not hard to change back.
well I figured that but I don't know what key it is
see what seb128 just said... that bug also notes how to change it back...
if you read his side... it really does make sense... although I think they should have just changed the button order (left to close parent go to child, middle for just opening parent)
then you can't have used it that much... I've had (I counted, just cuz it was a mess) 26 windows open at one time... I certainly didn't need them all...
imo... most common usage should be the left click action...
most common usage for most is to browse... not to copy files...
well I prefer to use a gui to reraange or clean up my files not necessarily to browse to a given document...for those purposes I usually havs links on my desktop
still... you won't need 20+ windows... maybe up to like 4 or so depending on how much rearranging  :/
